qas.question: What geographical location in Eritrea has largely shaped the culture of Eritrea?
What is one of the most recognizable parts of Eritran culture that can be offered when visiting friends as well as being a daily staple of life?
How many rounds is coffee served in during a coffee ceremony?
What do Eritrean's offer a person who declines coffee?
What is the first round of the coffee ceremony called?
What is the first round of coffee called in Italian?
What is the second round of coffee called in Italian?
What is the third round of coffee called in Italian?
What is someone served if they don't drink coffee or tea?
What is one of the least drank beverages in Eretria?

context: The culture of Eritrea has been largely shaped by the country's location on the <a0_0>Red Sea coast<a0_0/>. One of the most recognizable parts of Eritrean culture is <a1_0>the coffee ceremony<a1_0/>. Coffee (Ge'ez ቡን <b8_0>būn<b8_0/>) is offered when visiting friends, during festivities, or as a daily staple of life. During the coffee ceremony, there are traditions that are upheld. The coffee is served in <a2_0>three<a2_0/> rounds: the first brew or round is called <a4_0><b5_0>awel<b5_0/><a4_0/> in Tigrinya meaning first, the second round is called <b6_0>kalaay<b6_0/> meaning second, and the third round is called <b7_0>bereka<b7_0/> meaning "to be blessed". If coffee is politely declined, then <a3_0>most likely <b9_0>tea<b9_0/><a3_0/> ("shai" ሻሂ shahee) will instead be served.
